definition: abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"

sentences.english: My grandfather was dying also and only survived her a few weeks.
sentences.chinese: 外公也時日無多，只比外婆多活了幾個星期。

sentences.english: Both of us knew he had little time left.
sentences.chinese: 我倆都知道他已時日無多了。

sentences.english: And for a while it seemed as if the days of chimney sweeps were numbered.
sentences.chinese: 暫時看來似乎煙囪清掃人的需求也時日無多。

sentences.english: Knowing that he did not have much time left, my grandfather asked my mother to prepare the mourning clothes.
sentences.chinese: 爺爺自知時日無多，吩咐媽媽準備葬禮用的五服。

sentences.english: If he doesn't get this large contract, John's days may be numbered at the company.
sentences.chinese: 約翰若沒做成這筆大生意，那他在公司就時日無多了。

sentences.english: Still, the ethanol industry's days may be numbered.
sentences.chinese: 但是乙醇工業仍然時日無多。

definition: to like looking attractive (usually of girls)/aestheticism
lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/nitpicking/overcritical
to have a high notion of one's duty/to be highly principled
the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
